reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Santiago for three nights at the Radisson Plaza. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Always greeting with a smile. Hotel is a short walk to the subway so getting around the city was easy. Always cabs at the front door, but we prefer to explore as if we lived there. Breakfasts in the morning were a great way to start the day. Hotel is in a very safe location, but with easy access to transportation.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The staff is very helpful and attentive. The location is great! I would definitely stay there again the next time I travel to Santiago.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, let me say that the service at this hotel was great. If anything, it was a bit too much, as the staff were always hovering to see if you needed help when in the lobby or restaurant. The hotel itself is quite nice, with spacious rooms and is very clean. The all-you-can-eat breakfast was great, with a lot of choices and fresh-squeezed juices. We also received a free pisco sour at the bar, which we definitely appreciated. The only thing is that the hotel is far away from the downtown core, as it is in the business/upper end part of town. Having said that, I would probably stay here again because, even though it is far from things like La Moneda and the bus/train stations, there is a subway stop very close to the hotel (Tobalaba). It is less than a five minute walk to the station and the subway is cheap and fast, with no transfers needed to get downtown. Also, you can walk to Cerro San Cristobal from the hotel, which is a lovely park. It is about 20-25 minutes away. I would recommend not eating around the hotel though, the restaurants are overpriced and touristy.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, but a bit far from downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a executive hotel, with all you can expect from this kind of staying. Big room very clean, wonderful bed, great restaurant and bar. The breakfast is just regular, not compatible with the rest of the hotel. Avoid take taxi with the hotel, because the rates are very very superior to the taxis in the street.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With an AMEX special for $95/night and Andes view room this hotel was an incredible deal. This included breakfast, two free pisco sour drinks, two token gifts from the hotel shop, and free use of internet at the business center (I am a member, so it is possible that some were perks). BTW, we arrived around 10:30 am and the room was available. Location of the hotel was also good with the metro station only a couple of blocks away; added plus was an incredible supermarket next to it. Concierge was very helpful.
reviews.title: Luxury at budget price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a dichotomy about this hotel. On the one hand, it is decently-located though in a busier section of Santiago. The best part is the staff, who from check-in desk, concierge, repair people, bartenders to car drivers, work very hard at providing a high level of service. The lobby is attractive. The small bar is cute. The hotel is in walking distance to many restaurants and the subway. The rate is average to slightly above average for Santiago. The free breakfast is extensive though doesn't change up and is of only average quality. The rooms need a facelift. They are dark, somewhat dingy and in need of maintenance. Our shower head leaked all over. A lamp did not work. Immediately upon complaining, however, a repair person was dispatched to resolve the problems. Although I was told I had a view and tranquil room, we were awakened every morning to the din of heavy Santiago traffic. The pillows were dirty. With a few corrections, this hotel could be one worthy of a recommendation.
reviews.title: A mixed bag

reviews.text: The Radisson Hotel is convenienty located closed both to what in Santiago is called "Sanhattan" that is the business district of the city and a couple of "Avenidas" full of restaurants and cafè.
reviews.title: perfect location for business and pleasure

reviews.text: The location is quiet, safe and easy to be reached if you are travelling by car.
reviews.title: Great choise for business travellers

reviews.text: Rooms ( smoking and not smoking) are quite spacious, comfortable and offer nice views ( especially at the high floors)
reviews.title: Will be Back

reviews.text: The staff ( both the front desk and the concierge) is absolutely friendly, efficient and helpful .
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Radisson Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the business district which is buzzing weekdays but lovely and quiet at weekends. It's about a 5 min walk to the subway, and also on the hop on hop off santiago city tour route. Our room was spacious- even enough space to unpack all our clothes etc and still have plenty of room. Comfy bed, two seater settee, writing desk plasma TV with satellite channels, bathroom and toilet, with separate washbasin area. Breakfast was adequate without being outstanding, the scrambled eggs looked unappetising and fried eggs or omelettes were not readily available. Service in the hotel was good, from the initial greeting through to checkout. Concierge service was good and provided helpful advice. We didn't have dinner at the hotel, but did discover a wonderful cafe and ice cream place on El Bosque Norte 166,( 5 mins away). The passion fruit icecream is to die for. We found the hotel to be good value for money at weekends and would recommend it without hesitation.
reviews.title: modern hotel in business district

reviews.text: It's a pretty nice hotel, located about 2 blocks away from the main subway line. Rooms were nice and spacious, with comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet was great. I wish the hotel had an outdoor pool (it has a small indoor one). Wi-fi was flakey. Overall you get everything you can expect from a chain hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Radisson for a couple of nights as our jumping off point to Patagonia. I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed.
reviews.title: A good choice in Santiago - all expectations met!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a safe business district some distance way from downtown. But it's only 2 blocks away from the Tobalaba subway/metro station (along Tobalaba street in front of the hotel). This metro station is on Line 1, which takes you to all of the Tourist locations. The metro is clean & efficient with trains arriving every 5 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within 1-2 blocks, you can find a bunch of banks for ATM access and a quick mart to buy bottle water, snacks.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being located in El Golf business area, it is a business hotel, but we stayed for pleasure only, for a week, prior to a cruise. (This was our second trip to Santiago, first time at this hotel.) A short walk to the metro, the river and Providencia shopping and restaurants. Short cab ride to Los Condes and Parque Arauco. The hotel is small, only 6 rooms or so per floor, occupying a thin sliver on the edge of an office buidling, so one is not overwhelmed as in larger hotels. Great rates compared to some other hotels in more "touristy" locations. Great views from the small, but adequate, gym on the top floor. Great breakfast buffet with very friendly staff. Two nice bars. The staff made the stay. Extremely friendly. The concierge staff couldn't do enough to be of assistance and provide help and advice.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location. The staff in exceptional. The breakfast was delicious. Very, very nice.
reviews.title: We loved thos hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in the hotel and loved it. Las Condes is defnitely the best place to stay in Santiago (it is a rich, safe area). Close to restaurants and shops, including a big supermarket, and a subway station (which takes you anywhere in Santiago).
reviews.title: Great hotel in Las Condes
Hotels South America
reviews.text: The staff is great, the rooms were excellent (comfortable beds, flat screen TV, good airco etc.). Very good breakfast (included with the room). Great view of the whole city from the top floor swimming pool/fitness center.

I suggest to book with the hotel directly on the website, as it is cheaper than the hotel booking websites. Plus, when we checked out and paid, we ended up not having to pay the room tax for some reason (maybe it depends on which country you are from), which made the hotel considerably cheaper.
reviews.title: Very good business hotel
